StringTokenizer

splits a FXString to several Tokens.  Provides a seperator, which let’s the user choose where to split

Summary
StringTokenizer
splits a FXString to several Tokens.
Functions
StringTokenizer
reinit() has to be called to initialize the StringTokenizer
StringTokenizer
creates and initializes the StringTokenizer
~StringTokenizer
reinit
initializes the StringTokenizer after creation.
getNextToken
returns next Token of the splitted String, returns an empty String, if no Token is left
getAllTokens
returns all Tokens in an array.

Functions

StringTokenizer

StringTokenizer()

reinit() has to be called to initialize the StringTokenizer

StringTokenizer

StringTokenizer(FXString line,
FXchar separator)

creates and initializes the StringTokenizer

~StringTokenizer

~StringTokenizer()

reinit

void reinit(FXString line,
FXchar separator)

initializes the StringTokenizer after creation.  Must be called, if the StringTokenizer is created by the default constructor.  May be called to reinit a StrongTokenizer with another String or Separator

getNextToken

FXString getNextToken()

returns next Token of the splitted String, returns an empty String, if no Token is left

getAllTokens

FXArray<FXString> getAllTokens()

returns all Tokens in an array. getAllTokens doesn’t effect getNextToken
